sentence.text: This male was born as part of a monozygotic twin at 39 weeks of age with a weight of 3500 g (75%).
At 13 months length was 77.5 cm (50%) and OFC 50 cm (+6.5 SD).

He had frontal bossing, a large anterior fontanel, prominent eyes, hypertelorism, a small upturned nose, a triangular mouth, gingival hyperplasia, low-set ears, mesomelic upper limb shortening, short fingers and toes, a small penis and cryptorchidism.
X-rays showed hypoplasia of phalanges and bifid first and second fingers.
At 14 years of age facial dysmorphisms were less striking and intelligence was normal.
Hypertelorism, brachydactyly and mesomelia were present.
At 21 years of age growth remained with the same features (height 185.5 cm (75%), weight 88 kg (90%) and OFC 62 cm, (+4 SD)), but proportionate, and intelligence was normal.
Multiple orthodontic treatments had been performed for dental malalignment.
